text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Sugamata was born in Utsunomiya on November 29, 1957. After graduating from Hosei University, he joined Japan Soccer League club Hitachi in 1980. The club won the 2nd place in 1980 JSL Cup and 1982 Japan Soccer League. He retired in 1987. He played 131 games in the league. He was selected Best Eleven in 1980 and 1982). On July 23, 1978, when Sugamata was a Hosei University student, he debuted for the Japan national team against Singapore. After he joined Hitachi, he played for Japan again in June 1980. In December, he was selected Japan for 1982 World Cup qualification. In 1982, he also played at 1982 Asian Games. He played 23 games for Japan until 1984. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1978||1||0 |- |1979||0||0 |- |1980||7||0 |- |1981||3||0 |- |1982||6||0 |- |1983||5||0 |- |1984||1||0 |- !Total||23||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Tochigi Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Kashiwa Reysol players
title: Tetsuo Sugamata
